author: smartprogrammer
content:
Hey,
Ive got a question for our seasoned CL devs, when does the effective balance of a proposer gets updated when slashed. I am asking this because i want to know if the lookahead of the next epoch would change if a validator gets slashed in the current epoch.
Eth2book says the lookahead doesnt get updated when a validator is slashed but i checked the spec and the compute_proposer_index method takes the effective balance into consideration which would change the lookahead if changed by slashing

author: dapplion
content: Effective balance is updated in the epoch transition, so proposer selection is stable through the same epoch

author: smartprogrammer
content: but the next one gets affected (which is in the lookahead) thank you

author: dapplion
content: Proposer selection is meant to have zero lookahead. Under some circustances you speculate the selection 1,2 epochs in the future

author: smartprogrammer
content: With pectra it will get worse as effective balance for validators with more than 32 eth will also affect the lookahead of the next epoch, something to keep in mind i guess

author: tersec
content: the main issue would be epoch transition slots, haven't looked at edge cases around those, for proposer selection

author: potuz
content: We do try to guess two epochs in advance if we will be proposing

author: potuz
content: And keep this in a cache that we anyway recompute just in time later
